column4: so does anyone know how to remote into a current session instead of creating a new one?
x11vnc
i have nx installed, i tried to use x11vnc
the nx server always creates a new session
ssh to machine, type sudo aptitude install x11vnc - when she is logged in, type x11vnc, wait a few secs, and connect
ok...
I do this 'ssh remotemachine -L 5900:localhost:5900' , then start x11vnc, then on local machine: vncviewer localhost:0
although i have to ask, why the "vncviewer localhost:0"?
because you forwarded her port to your machine for security
ok... i did what you said and it's sitting there
would you mind? http://pastebin.com/d527b0497
yep, now open another terminal and type vncviewer localhost:0
on her machine?
on yours
i don't have vncviewer evidently...
you have told your machine to pretend x11vnc is running on your machine
i don't know what you mean by that...
install it or krdc or go to internet>terminal server client
in terminal server client, you put localhost:0 ad the computer and hit connect
hey... thanks!  it works!!
sure does :)
http://ubuntu-georgia.org/installing_ubuntu_and_windows_xp_on_separate_drives
